quest.name: The Legend of Musosai
journal: Makoto looks to be preparing for a journey.

Makoto informs you that she is about to depart for Eorzea in order to visit Musosai's grave. Believing the timing of your arrival to be fortuitous, she invites you to accompany her on the journey, and you are happy to oblige. Upon arriving in Ul'dah, she says that she will first call on your showmaster friend, Momozigo, at the Quicksand.
You and Makoto come to the Quicksand, but Momozigo is presently absent. For now, you decide to continue on to the Silver Bazaar, where Musosai was laid to rest.

At the Silver Bazaar, Makoto cannot help but notice the presence of folk attired as samurai. While the observation is indeed curious, you set them aside in your mind for now and proceed to Musosai's grave.

Kneeling before Musosai's grave, Makoto tells him of your victory over Ugetsu and his insurgents. No sooner does she finish her report than a commotion breaks out nearby, and she instinctively dashes off to investigate. Catching up to her, you are met with the sight of a familiar-looking Roegadyn. The man takes exception at those who are dressed as samurai, saying that they sully Musosai's memory. As soon as he sees you, however, he flees the scene as if his life depended on it. Her interest piqued by the fact that he knows both you and Musosai, Makoto decides to give chase, and you follow on her heels in the direction of the docks.

It doesn't take long for you and Makoto to corner the mystery man, who is revealed to be none other than Ostyrgrein, the bodyguard you defeated on the deck of a ship once upon a time. He claims he has since mended his ways, and desiring to become a true samurai, has taken to visiting Musosai's grave daily. Recently, however, someone has been telling the tale of Musosai's quest to right wrongs, which resulted in the Silver Bazaar becoming something of a tourist attraction. This led to his earlier outburst, which in turn led you and Makoto to him. Ostyrgrein then begs you to take him on as his pupil, but you are reluctant to do so. Sensing his determination, Makoto invites him to come to Kugane to train, and he happily accepts. Before they depart for the Far East, however, Makoto suggests returning once more to the Quicksand, where she believes another familiar face may be found telling a familiar tale.

As Makoto had suspected, the storyteller who has been spreading the tale of Musosai's deeds is none other than Momozigo, and he begins another session soon after you arrive. You listen intently as he dramatically recounts your journey with your former master, the words bringing your memories of that time back to vivid life. Afterwards, you share with him your recent adventures in the First, that he might add to his repertoire. Having bid Makoto and Ostyrgrein farewell, Momozigo urges you to keep up fighting the good fight, that Musosai's legacy might live on not only in you, but in others besides.
objectives: Speak with Makoto at the Silver Bazaar.

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: Forename, how good of you to pay me visit, and now of all times!

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: You see, I'm about to depart for Eorzea to visit Master Musosai's grave, to tell him of our victory over Ugetsu.

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: That you should come to me at this juncture is most fortuitous. Would you do me the honor of accompanying me on this journey?

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: Thank you, my friend. And lest you wonder, I've not forgotten about Momozigo. I would call on him as well. Upon arriving, let us first go to the Quicksand.

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: I'm afraid Momozigo isn't here. According to the folk here, he is in the midst of preparing for another spectacle.

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: Though I'm curious as to what he has in store, we shouldn't keep Master Musosai waiting. Let us go to his grave first.

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: The place was the Silver Bazaar, if I recall correctly. Come, let us be on our way.

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: The town is much livelier than I recall...and there are folk attired as samurai besides. Curious.

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: But come, Master Musosai awaits.

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: We did it, Master Musosai.

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: With Forename standing with us, we defeated Ugetsu and put an end to his madness.

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: And your teachings, your legacy─they live on in the Sekiseigumi. So please rest easy.

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: 'Tis done. Thank you for accompanying me.

dialogue.name: OSTYRGREIN
dialogue.text: (-???-)Argh! I won't stand for this mummery!

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: That sounds like trouble. Let us go and see what is afoot.

dialogue.name: OSTYRGREIN
dialogue.text: (-Familiar Fellow-)Dressing like a samurai don't make you one! You bastards sully Master Musosai's memory!

dialogue.name: OSTYRGREIN
dialogue.text: (-Familiar Fellow-)Thal's balls, it's...it's you! Uwaaaaaah!

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: That man knows you and Master Musosai both. I would find out who he is.

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: We have him, Forename.

dialogue.name: OSTYRGREIN
dialogue.text: (-Familiar Fellow-)F-Forgive me! I've learned my lesson! Since you trounced me on the ship, I've mended my ways!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You're that false samurai!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Ostyrgrein!

dialogue.name: OSTYRGREIN
dialogue.text: (-Ostyrgrein-)A-Aye, I'm Ostyrgrein. The bodyguard to a serial killer who thought he could take you on.

dialogue.name: OSTYRGREIN
dialogue.text: (-Ostyrgrein-)But I've stopped selling my sword to crooks. I lead an honest life now, selling toad oil.

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: It seems to me the evil in this man has been excised.

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: You have naught to fear from Forename. Please be at ease, and tell us the cause of your earlier outburst.

dialogue.name: OSTYRGREIN
dialogue.text: (-Ostyrgrein-)You see, after I saw what a true samurai could do, I knew I wanted to become one too. So I sought Master Musosai out, hoping he'd take me on as a pupil...

dialogue.name: OSTYRGREIN
dialogue.text: (-Ostyrgrein-)...Only to learn he'd already passed away. Since then, I've been visiting his grave every day in order to get inspiration.

dialogue.name: OSTYRGREIN
dialogue.text: (-Ostyrgrein-)Recently, though, someone's been telling the tale of Master Musosai's quest to right wrongs at the Quicksand. On account of that, people started dressing up like samurai and flocking to his grave like it's some godsdamned spectacle. But they're false, the whole lot of 'em! Falser than I ever was!

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: I had the honor of knowing Master Musosai. And the Master Musosai I knew would be glad if his tale inspired others to follow in his footsteps.

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: And though he was a solitary man, he did not spurn the company of others. I don't believe he would mind the crowds.

dialogue.name: OSTYRGREIN
dialogue.text: (-Ostyrgrein-)Really? Well, I suppose you'd know better than me... Ah! But of course!

dialogue.name: OSTYRGREIN
dialogue.text: (-Ostyrgrein-)Might be as Master Musosai is gone, but you were his pupil! I beg you, teach me how to be a true samurai like you!

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I don't have the time.

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: Forename has much demands on herhis time and is not in a position to take on pupils. But if you are determined to learn, I invite you to come to Kugane. I can introduce you to schools of swordsmanship.

dialogue.name: OSTYRGREIN
dialogue.text: (-Ostyrgrein-)Y-You mean I can train in the Far East? Where it all began? I'd love nothing more! It'd be a dream come true!

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: Very well. A long journey is better with company. Let us return to Kugane together.

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: Though I wonder, this someone who has been telling the tale of Master Musosai's quest... It seems to me it could only be one person.

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: It would be a shame to have come all this way and not see our friend. Let us try visiting the Quicksand again.

dialogue.name: OSTYRGREIN
dialogue.text: It shames me to say I don't actually know much about Master Musosai. I'd be interested in hearing this tale myself.

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: As I had suspected, Momozigo is indeed our storyteller. And as luck would have it, he's about to begin another session.

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: Gather ye around, one and all, and listen to my tale...

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: A tale that began with an unlikely meeting between a young adventurer and an elderly samurai hailing from the Far East.

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: Known as Musosai, the samurai took on challengers upon the bloodsands. Many answered his call, but none had an answer to his transcendent swordsmanship. For a time, it seemed that he would go undefeated...

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: But there came one unassuming adventurer. Wielding the katana, a foreign weapon shehe had theretofore never held, shehe fought with heart and skill to claim victory!

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: After journeying the realm over, vanquishing evil together, never could the adventurer have imagined that, for herhis final test, shehe must vanquish Musosai himself.

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: Left with no recourse, shehe drew herhis katana and faced herhis friend and master.

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: A grueling battle unfolded, with neither side yielding a single ilm. The adventurer brought herhis all to bear, but shehe was matched at every turn by Musosai, who unleashed technique after deadly technique, betraying no signs of the illness that ravaged his body.

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: But at the end of a contest of equals, it was the younger samurai who dealt the final blow to emerge the victor. HerHis master had trained herhim well.

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: As he lay battered and bloodied on the snow, Musosai demanded that his pupil finish it. Shutting herhis eyes tight, the adventurer raised herhis katana...

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: WHOOSH! The blade traced a vicious arc!

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: ...And cleaved empty air. The adventurer had excised the evil in Musosai, as Musosai himself had done for those who could yet be redeemed.

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: So it was that the elderly samurai found peace in his final moment. It is said that his soul now rests atop the cliff by the Silver Bazaar, where he gazes out at the setting sun.

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: And somewhere out there, the young adventurer continues herhis noble master's legacy, fighting for justice and vanquishing evil wheresoever it should exist.

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: So ends my tale─the Legend of Musosai. Thank you all for your kind attention.

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: You know, it's harder to do this with you lot in the audience...but it's good to see you all─even Mister Fake Samurai.

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: You're doubtless wondering how I fell into my new calling. Well, during my trip to Kugane, I had the chance to hear a storyteller at the Mujikoza. I knew right away that this is what I wanted to do─what my gift of the gab was meant for.

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: That was a masterful and heartfelt retelling. I pray that you will continue to share the tale of Master Musosai with all the world.

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: You can depend on it! Though of course, if I'm to be a storyteller worth my salt, I'll need some variety in my repertoire.

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: Forename, you're still out there doing your adventuring, aren't you? Don't you have any new tales to share that could make for a good yarn?

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you tell him about?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: The struggle to save the First.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: The hunt for Andreia.

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: By the Twelve... Your quest to right wrongs took you across the rift and to another world? Truth really is stranger than fiction...

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: My thanks, Forename! This will be a splendid addition to my tales!

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: I'm afraid it is time we sought our ship. Brief though it was, I'm glad for our reunion.

dialogue.name: OSTYRGREIN
dialogue.text: I'm gonna train hard in Hingashi, an' I'm gonna come back a real samurai! Jus' you watch!

dialogue.name: MAKOTO
dialogue.text: If your travels should bring you to Kugane again, please come and seek me out at the barracks. Till next time...

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: To think that pretender would have a change of heart and try to become a true samurai... The old man will be pleased.

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: It goes to show, Musosai's legacy truly lives on in you, Forename. And it takes root even in the hearts of those you've sliced up.

dialogue.name: MOMOZIGO
dialogue.text: So keep fighting the good fight, my friend. And remember to visit me from time to time to share more of your tales!
